item.title: Daily Blogroll: 2025-11-01
item.description:
Syp journeys through Southern Mirkwood, appreciating the views while juggling gaming breaks and family adventures.

Nimgimli reflects on a Halloween filled with decorations and unmemorable game endings, fueled by the joys of "Little Rocket Lab."

Heartless navigates through the grief stages following the end of New World, currently stuck in a hopeful bargaining phase.

Azuriel bids farewell to Hearthstone over frustrating event quests, marking a bitter end to over a decade-long journey.

Belghast tackles the launch day grind of Path of Exile's Keepers League, embodying spooky vibes and raiding triumphs.

Wilhelm triumphs over WordPress' timezone gremlins while humorously fending off Kindle mishaps and nostalgic game updates.

WCRobinson eagerly reviews Hades II, celebrating its captivating expansion on the original's formula with new characters and secrets.

Emily reflects on an emotional October, finding solace in eclectic tunes spanning Taylor Swift to classics like KISS.

Bruce Schneier marvels at a Smithsonian giant squid while tackling unblogged security stories in classic squid blog fashion.

Dave Winer gets Feedland up to speed, offering a smoother ride through automated scaling delights.

Aywren vows to conquer her writing backlog by year’s end, determined to chronicle gaming adventures before memories fade.

Tipa dives into the rich, isolated world of Gormenghast, urging readers not to miss its wonderous narrative peaks.

item.title: Daily Blogroll: 2025-11-02
item.description:
Tipa dives into a meditative mouse adventure and a hellish auto-shooter from Ron Gilbert—perfect for a cozy evening in.

Frostilyte tackles epic sequels and indie showcases, urging players to wishlist and explore new gaming adventures.

Wilhelm wrestles with Apple's streaming overhaul and a sci-fi series that misses the mark on alien suspense.

Tobold explores a strategy game meshing Total War tactics with strategic looting amid the Seven Years' War.

Michael highlights a batch of indie delights, from interactive fiction to retro vibes, perfect for cozy fall gaming.

Anarchae reflects on spooky reads and sports thrills, making time for jigsaws and cozy Fall pastimes.

Axxuy embraces seasonal changes and maritime tunes, despite Halloween's rainy interruption.

CrazyKinux marvels at a heartfelt tribute to Miyazaki's world, crafted with love and reverence by a passionate team.

Dave Winer shares thoughts on respectful email sign-ups and the enduring confusion of RSS naming conventions.

item.title: Daily Blogroll: 2025-11-03
item.description:
Tipa shares the epic showdown with the shape-shifting villain Qwindrak, proving villains never learn about secret lair loopholes.

Shintar enjoys SWTOR flashpoints across servers, embracing differences in player dynamics and community vibes.

Belghast's crew dives into Path of Exile and discusses New World's unfortunate descent into zombie mode.

Wilhelm's waiting game continues as Dispatch struggles to gather enough 'Top Critic' reviews for a league score.

Tobold anticipates Europa Universalis V while navigating board game nights and logistics at Spiel 2025.

Anarchae reflects on piecing together Monet's Water Lilies during a marathon baseball game, minus one pesky piece.

Michael curates a blend of gaming and tech gems while highlighting the joys of a thriving internet community.

Tim Bray ditches Google for Pagefind, embracing a new era of effective blog searches.

Dave Winer muses on the end of baseball season and shares tips on using NetNewsWire for RSS feeds.

item.title: Daily Blogroll: 2025-11-04
item.description:
Stargrace strategizes over potentially lucrative pet trades amid a chaotic gaming schedule.

Kimimi dives into 'Night Striker Gear,' celebrating retro graphics with modern flair in this exciting shmup.

Scopique dives into 'Dispatch,' a game that breathes new life into superhero tropes with humor and open-ended gameplay.

Belghast enjoys Path of Exile's new Breach mechanic but finds himself over-farming in an ever-enticing league.

Wilhelm chronicles the climb to level 71 in Pokémon Go and the strange appeal of task-focused progression.

Anarchae reflects on the delicate balance of maintaining anonymity while job hunting in the digital age.

Bhagpuss explores how Rashida Jones' new AppleTV+ show 'Sunny' quenches the sitcom thirst with a twist of sci-fi amid Kyoto's allure.

A heartfelt update from The Friendly Necromancer shares gratitude for support amid his ongoing health journey.

Michael reminisces about roller rinks' nostalgic charm while navigating kids and top 40 tunes.

Dave Winer highlights the power of WebSockets for faster feeds, aiming to simplify syndication beyond RSS.

Remy Porter humorously deconstructs a woeful captcha implementation that's easy pickings for bots.

JJM nostalgically navigates DOS programming to master VGA tricks for an old-school gaming vibe.

item.title: Daily Blogroll: 2025-11-05
item.description:
Stargrace excitedly announces her return to the EverQuest II scene as part of the content creator program.

Tipa dives into the charm of the Vectrex console while backing the nostalgic Vectrex Mini Kickstarter.

Juhis reflects on the fluctuating cycles of writing inspiration and the challenge of overcoming creative ruts.

Heartless vents frustration over the Packers' loss to the Panthers and questions managerial decisions.

Belghast navigates a sleepless night with gaming achievements amidst real-life interruptions.

Anarchae shares updates on their Bearblog theme iterations, adding customization and improving usability.

Joargarrosh considers the shifts in life plans, highlighting the importance of stepping back to see the big picture.

Jamie Zawinski troubleshoots issues with the Pi 4 and MAX7219, pondering why older setups worked better.

Bruce Schneier warns about the latest digital scam hitting payroll systems through social engineering.

Dave Winer reflects on political shifts and the importance of integrity, even in unlikely alliances.

Remy Porter unveils the mystery of crashing C# applications due to unnoticed background task exceptions.

Aywren explores the uniquely challenging world of Echoes of the Plum Grove, blending cozy gaming with harsh realities.
